questions.questionText: Evaluate whether the following data handling practice complies with GDPR

content.statement: A company stores customer email addresses indefinitely without obtaining explicit consent and uses them for marketing purposes without providing an opt-out mechanism.

questions.hint: Consider GDPR requirements for consent, data retention, and user rights
questions.explanation: This practice violates GDPR in multiple ways: (1) explicit consent is required for marketing purposes, (2) data should not be retained indefinitely without justification, and (3) users must have the ability to opt-out of marketing communications. GDPR requires lawful basis for processing, data minimization, and respect for user rights.

questions.questionText: Evaluate this password policy for security compliance

content.statement: Passwords must be at least 12 characters long, contain uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters, and must be changed every 90 days.

questions.hint: Consider modern password security best practices like NIST guidelines
questions.explanation: This policy is compliant with most security standards. It enforces strong password complexity (12+ characters with mixed character types) and regular rotation. While some modern guidance suggests password rotation may not always be necessary, a 90-day rotation is still considered acceptable for high-security environments.
